intro: Ilex manneiensis, commonly known as the Mannein Island holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the island of Mannein in the South China Sea and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution, Ilex manneiensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
